basics.name: Al Jachimiak
basics.label: Senior Developer
basics.summary:
I’m a self-taught engineer that is about to start his 6th year as a professional in the tech industry. I develop front-end user interfaces that are easy to use and create back-end API's that are engineer-friendly, maintainable, and scalable.

As an engineer, I’ve got lots of experience using React and Vue to make great user interfaces. On the backend, I've written services in nodejs and go, as well as several years of experience in C#.

I’m also good communicator. In my previous career as a public school teacher, I helped students understand complex topics by first understanding the topics and then communicating the material in an impactful way. I bring that experience to technology companies by understanding both the business and technology problems, and translating the needs of stakeholders to create a plan for success that is sustainable across teams.

work.summary: Odd Networks is a leader in the OTT technology, bringing the latest in Video Streaming technology to mobile and television connected devices like Roku, AppleTV, Amazon Fire. We deliver video content to millions of devices, which is managed through the Odd Networks Dashboard.
highlights: Designing features for the Odd Networks dashboard and developing them using React and Redux.
Developing new features on Nodejs and Go backend systems for API mnagement, content delivery, and event collection for metrics and analytics.
Building and deploying client applications on iOS, Android, tvOS, android-tv, Amazon Fire, and Roku.
Working with clients to build custom applications and training content managers to use content and platform dashboards.

work.summary: Castle Learning is a K-12 educational technology product that allows teachers to give students digital assignments and gives students a fully responsive platform to complete their assignments.  Castle also provides analysis of student response data to help drive instruction, provide high quality content to teachers, and provide students with many different methods to review material and improve their skills.
highlights: Re-architected the student interface to allow for full functionality on desktops, tablets, and phones.
Implemented new reports for with client side charts and graphs for data interpretation.
Introduced new data structures and modeling to increase query speed, decrease data transfer, and increase server-side efficiency of data analysis algorithms.
Conducted seven different bands, percussion ensembles, and jazz ensembles spanning grades 7-12.
Designed an Advanced Placement music theory curriculum.
Deployed computer based testing (Tao Testing)

volunteer.summary: Hour of Code is a global movement reaching tens of millions of students in 180+ countries.

volunteer.organization: Mid Hudson Valley Linux Users Group
volunteer.summary: MHVLUG, founded in 2003, is an informal organization, that is first and foremost about making a constructive, sharing, and welcoming community. MHVLUG promotes the use and education of open technologies.
highlights: Used Vagrant to make the monthly presentation dev environment available across many platforms

references.name: Kris Walker, CTO - Oddnetworks.com
references.reference: Al is a multi faceted engineer comfortable in a range of technologies used in modern web development...

references.name: Carlos Puchol, CEO - Amahi.org
references.reference: I am proud to recommend Al with highest regards! There are a few things that are rare to find in combination in a technical person. Al has both excellent design skills and great front-end web-development skills. If that is not rare enough unto itself, Al adds one more that truly sets him apart: he's easy to work with. He gets the requirements quickly and gets on his way.....

references.name: Thomas Hein, Technical Services Coordinator - Wallkill CSD
references.reference: ...I assigned Al multiple projects, wireless deployment, iPad Cart deployment and Thin client rollout. Al completed each project, demonstrating his network and server administration skills. Al was a great asset...
